answers.answer: Hi, Thank you very much for your questions; although it is quite difficult for me to give you a precise opinion here without being able to examine you, but I would try to provide you some relevant information about your upper back & neck pain. Your symptoms could be suggestive of either some nerve injury or a pressure on the nerve due to the muscle spasms. Another possibility in your case could be damaged the soft-tissues such as muscles and ligaments if you are over-doing any shoulder exercises or lifting heavy weights. Since you have persistent pain, I would recommend you to see a neurologist who can evaluate the details of your case and could better determine the insight of your situation.  In addition, it will be best if you would also visit a physiotherapist to let him/her assess your back and shoulders.  Hope this helps.

question: Hello,I am a 19 year old male.  For the past three months, I have been experiencing horrible upper-back and neck aches.  Also, I get bad pressure/tightness like headaches right where my occipital muscle is.  It feels as if someone is pulling/pushing my neck.  It's so uncomfortable because it gives me a woozy feeling all day.  In addition, I have tightness right over where my collar bone is.  I have been to countless doctors including my GP, an Endocrinologist and a Neurologist.  I have been tested for diabetes, thyroid disorders, multiple sclerosis and even had an EMG performed.  The MRI's that I got didn't show any problem within my brain or my spinal cord, however I still feel pain.  A while ago, I went to the gym and lifted heavy weights, more weight than I ever had before.  Could I have pulled a muscle or pinched a nerve that is causing all of these weird symptoms?  Thanks.
title: Upper Back/Neck Ache headache woozy feeling
